description: This egg fried in a rice is a great single-serving meal for days when you feel too lazy to cook. Adapted from Meals in a Mug.
name: Egg Fried Rice in a Mug
recipeIngredient: small pinch of mung bean sprouts
small pinch of shredded purple cabbage

recipeInstructions.text: Place the rice into a large mug. Lay the peas, red pepper, green onion, mung bean sprouts and cabbage on top. Cover the mug with cling film. Using a knife, puncture one or two small holes through the film. This step is important! You don’t want to scald yourself. Microwave on high for 1 minute 15 seconds.
In the meantime, beat the egg and mix in the seasonings (soy sauce, sesame oil, onion powder and five-spice powder). Pour the egg mixture into the mug, and stir with the vegetables and rice.

Cover the mug with cling film again, and microwave for 1 minute 15 seconds to 1 minute 30 seconds. Take the mug out of the microwave, and give everything a good stir. Let the fried rice stand for a minute to finish cooking. Use a fork to fluff up the rice and serve.

video.description:
Want a quick and easy meal without cleaning too many dishes? This Gluten-Free Egg Fried Rice in a Mug is for you! It takes less than 10 minutes to make, and it's delicious! Yes, you can cook tasty food in your microwave! Full recipe: https://healthynibblesandbits.com/gluten-free-egg-fried-rice-in-a-mug/

Cooking Note: if you can adjust the power settings of your microwave, cook this dish at a power setting of 8 or 9 out of 10.
